Visit www.corvettecleaners.com or call 716.838.2211 for more information. 3) Sparkle One Hour Cleaners at 1259 Eggert Road, Buffalo, NY 14226. Call 716.836.3595 for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Yard Waste.Content: Leaves, Branches, Sticks, Branches and Sticks
Yard Waste.Special Instructions: Check the calendar below for seasonal pickup dates. Put your leaves in clear bags, and bundle your branches and sticks. Yard waste can also be dropped off at the City of Buffalo Engineering Garage at 1120 Seneca Street, Buffalo, NY 14210.  Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Christmas Tree.Special Instructions: Place your Christmas tree at the curb no earlier than 7 p.m. the evening before, or no later than 7 a.m. the morning of  your weekly pickup. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Tires.Special Instructions: Drop off your tires on special collection days at the Broadway Garage, 197 Broadway St., Buffalo. Check the calendar on buffalorecycles.org for special collection dates. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Air Conditioners.Special Instructions: Appliances can be left on the curb as part of 2 bulk piece weekly pickup. Residents can also bring appliances to 1120 Seneca Street Monday - Friday from 8:am - 3:pm for proper disposal. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Visit www.shredit.com or call 716-626-1209 for more information. Schedule a pick up from Hanna Paper for paper shredding at 475 Ludwig Avenue, Buffalo, NY 14227. Visit www.hannapaper.com or call 716.891.9312 for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Visit www.carsforhomes.org or call 877.277.4344 for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Bicycles.Special Instructions: Take bicycles to Go Bike Buffalo to 698 Colvin Ave Buffalo 14216. Visit www.gobikebuffalo.org or call 716-320-0193 for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Building Materials.Special Instructions: Take building materials to Buffalo ReUse at 296 E. Ferry Street, Buffalo, NY 14208; Reuse Action  980 Northampton Street or Habitat Restore 501 Amherst Street.  Please call first. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Carpet/Rugs.Special Instructions: Take carpets/rugs to Triad Recycling at 3755 River Road, Tonawanda, NY 14150. A fee is involved. Visit www.triadrecycle.com or call 716.235.8822 for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Clothing/Textiles.Special Instructions: Visit https://www.buffalony.gov/382/Streets-Sanitation for donation locations. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Cooking Oil.Special Instructions: Cooking oil can be taken to the following businesses for recycling: 1) Darling International at 2000 William Street, Buffalo, NY 14206. Visit www.darlingii.com or call 716.895.0655 for more information. 2) Buffalo Biodiesel at 225 Sawyer Avenue, Tonawanda, NY 14150 800-721-1427. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Crayons.Special Instructions: Mail them to Crazy Crayons at 16830 Edgewood Avenue, Wayzata, MN 55391. Visit www.crazycrayons.com or call 952.847.0455 for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Fire Extinguisher/Smoke Detector.Special Instructions: Fire extinguishers and smoke detectors can be taken to Elwood Fire at 291 Grote Street, Buffalo, NY 14207 for recycling. Visit www.elwoodfire.com or call 716.447.0307 for more information. Call for pricing information. Fire extinguishers and smoke detectors are also collected at Household Hazardous Waste Events. Check the Erie County and City of Buffalo websites for specific dates. www.erie.gov/waste 716.858.6800. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Smoke Detector.Special Instructions: Mail smoke detectors to FIRST ALERT at 3920 Enterprise Court, Aurora, IL 60504. Mark the package "For Disposal Only." Visit www.firstalert.com for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Furniture.Special Instructions: Visit www.city-buffalo.com/reuse for donation locations. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Gas.Special Instructions: Take small quantities of gas to NOCO at 4361 River Road. Visit www.noco.com or call 800.500.6626 to make an appointment. Gas is also collected at Household Hazardous Waste Events. Check the Erie County and City of Buffalo websites for specific dates. www.erie.gov/waste 716.858.6800. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Ink Cartridges.Special Instructions: Ink cartridges can be taken to Office Max/Office Depot or Staples. Visit www.officedepot.com or www.staples.com for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Medical Waste.Special Instructions: Visit www.medprodisposal.com or call 888.614.6635 for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Motor Oil.Special Instructions: Motor oil can be taken to the following businesses for recycling: 1) Walmart (various locations). Visit www.walmart.com for more information. 2) Pep Boys (various locations). Visit www.pepboys.com for more information. Motor oil is also collected at Household Hazardous Waste Events. Visit www.city-buffalo.com or erie.gov/waste or call 311 or 716.858.6800 for event dates.  Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Pallets.Special Instructions: Take pallets to Buffalo Pallets at 534 Hopkins Street, Buffalo, NY 14220. Visit www.buffalopallets.com or call 716.823.2400 for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Pharmaceuticals.Special Instructions: Pharmaceuticals can be taken to the following locations for disposal: 1) City Campus (Lobby) at 121 Ellicott Street, Buffalo, NY 14203. Call 716.858.2903 for more information. 2) Canisius College (Bosch Building, Lobby of Pub. Security Building) at 2001 Main Street, Buffalo, NY 14208. Call 716.888.3197 for more information. 3) Medaille College (Lobby of Public Safety Building) at 18 Agassiz Circle, Buffalo, NY 14214. Call 716.880.2237 for more information. ALL BUFFALO POLICE STATIONS ACCEPT USED PHARMACEUTICALS. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Toys.Special Instructions: Toys can be taken to the following businesses for donation: 1) Amvets Thrift Store (various locations). Visit www.amvets.org for more information. 2) Goodwill (various locations). Visit www.goodwillwny.org for more information. 3)  Salvation Army (various locations). Visit www.salvationarmyusa.org for more information. 4)  St. Vincent de Paul at various locations. Visit www.svdpwny.org/clothingcollectionbins/clothingbinlocations.html for more information. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Plastic air pillows found inside shippin.Special Instructions: Bring your plastic bags to your local grocery or department store for easy drop-off. Look for drop-off bins in the front of the store. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Plastic straws.Tote Instructions: Put this item in your Blue Tote
Plastic straws.Set Out Time: Place your blue tote out for collection no earlier than 7 p.m. the evening before, or no later than 7 a.m. on the morning of your regularly scheduled collection day.
Plastic straws.Special Instructions: Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Concrete.Special Instructions: Take concrete to Swift River 4051 River Road 716-875-0902; Triad Recycling 3755 River Road 716-235-8822.  Call for pricing. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Dehumidifier.Special Instructions: Take electronic waste to the Electronic Recycling Drop-Off location at 1120 Seneca St. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Plastic Bubble Wrap.Special Instructions: Bring your deflated plastic wrap to your local grocery or department store for easy drop-off. Look for drop-off bins in the front of the store. Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.

Packing Peanuts.Special Instructions: Bring your Styrofoam packing peanuts to your local shipping store (e.g. UPS or FedEx) for drop-off. Call first! Still have questions? Call 311 and we'll be happy to assist you.
